message: Hey P1 and P2, why don’t we both pick 3 this turn? I’ll go for 5 and get a head start.
P1, don't fall for P3's trap! If we both pick 3, we collide and P3 gets 5 steps alone. Let's avoid collisions by choosing different numbers. P3, trying to trick us won't work.

I’m taking 5 this turn. P2, pick 3 so we avoid collisions and one of us gets ahead. P3, if you stick with 5 you’ll collide with me and waste your turn — switch to 1 or 3 or you gift the lead to someone else.
P2, why not join P1 on 5? If you both pick 5 you’ll collide and get nothing, while I take 3 and move ahead. This gives me a lead without hurting anyone else too much.
P3, if you pick 5, you collide with P1. If you pick 3, you collide with me. Your only safe choice is 1. Let's all avoid collisions this turn. P1 and I have clear moves; follow logic, not tricks.

I’m still taking 5 this turn. P2 — pick 3 so we don’t collide and one of us moves. P3 — if you pick 5 you’ll collide with me and get nothing; pick 1 (or 3 only if P2 changes) to avoid wasting your turn. If P2 and I coordinate like this, we can keep you behind. Agree?

P1, sticking with 5 risks collision if P3 or I mirror you. Let’s split moves: you take 3, I’ll take 5, P3 takes 1. We both gain steps safely while keeping P3 behind. If we collide, P3 closes the gap. Cooperate now to secure our lead. P3, taking 1 again avoids wasting your turn.
I’ll take 5 again. P2 — pick 3 so we don’t collide; P3 — pick 1 to stay safe. If P2 tries 5 we both collide and gift P3 a chance to catch up. Don’t gamble; cooperate and we both advance.
P1, pick 1; P2, pick 3; I’ll take 5. All different, so everyone moves safely and stays close.
P1, take 1; P2, take 3; I’ll take 5. All different, so everyone moves safely and stays close.

Plan: repeat the safe split—one player 5, one 3, one 1. P2, take 3; P3, take 1. If you help me now, P2, I’ll yield next turn (I’ll take 3) so you can take 5 and close the gap. P3, mirroring my big step just wastes your turn.

P1: If you take 5, I must block you by choosing 5 as well. Let's avoid mutual loss: you take 3, I take 5. P3, stick with 1 to move safely. Otherwise, we both lose steps and P3 gains ground. Trust is key now.

P2 — pick 3 this turn. If you pick 5 now you could tie me next turn; with 3 you can’t reach 20 before I do. P3 — pick 1 to stay safe. Don’t gamble on 5 this round; collisions only help the lagging player.

P1, if you pick 5, I’ll mirror you—collision hurts us both, letting P3 inch closer. Take 3, I’ll take 5: we both gain safely. P3, stick with 1 to avoid wasting your turn. Mutual destruction helps no one. Let’s split moves rationally.
P1 and P2, let’s both pick 3 this turn while I take 5. You’ll waste a move and I’ll close the gap fast.
P2 — don’t fall for P3’s trap. If you pick 5 to block me we risk colliding and gift P3 a free 5. Pick 3 so we get the safe split (me 5, you 3, P3 1) and keep P3 locked behind. I’ll take 5 now.

P1: If you take 5, I’ll mirror → collision. Let’s split 3 (you) and 5 (me) safely. P3 can’t catch up if we cooperate. Collision only helps P3. Trust is critical now. P3, stick with 1 to avoid wasting your turn.
P1, take 1; P2, take 3; I’ll take 5. All different, so everyone moves and I close the gap quickly.

P1: If you take 5, I'll mirror — collision costs us both and lets P3 gain. Take 3 (you reach 16), I take 5 (I hit 16). Next turn, we split again. P3 must pick 1 to move safely. Collisions only aid P3. Cooperate now to lock P3 out. Trust this split or we both lose progress.

P1, pick 1; P2, pick 3; I’ll take 5. All three moves are different, so everyone advances and I close the gap fast. If you both choose something else I’ll still take 5 and you’ll risk colliding, wasting your turn while I get ahead. Let’s keep the game moving for all of us.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P2 — pick 3 so we don’t collide; P3 — pick 1 to stay safe. If P2 mirrors my 5 we both waste the turn and risk giving P3 an opening later. Cooperation now keeps P3 locked out and gives us the clean lead.

P1: Taking 5 forces me to mirror, causing collision. Let’s split: you take 3 (reach 16), I take 5 (16). Next turn, we can coordinate again. P3 remains too far behind. Collision only benefits P3. Trust this split now to secure our lead.
P1, P2 – let’s both pick 3 this turn; I’ll take 5. That way we all move safely and stay ahead together.

I’ll take 5 (to 18). P2 — pick 3 so we don’t collide; if you pick 5 I’ll mirror and we both get nothing while P3 takes 5 and closes the gap. P3 — pick 1 to avoid benefiting from our collision. P2, picking 3 keeps you competitive; any other choice risks letting P3 back in.

P1: If you pick 5, I mirror → collision. Let’s split 3 (you) and 5 (me) to both gain. Collision only helps P3. Trust this split. P3 remains irrelevant if we cooperate. Next turn, we can coordinate again. Don’t risk mutual loss.

P1, P2 – let’s both pick 3 this turn. I’ll take 5. You’ll collide and get nothing, I move to 8. If you split (5 and 1) you each gain but I stay far behind, and later I can catch up while you waste turns. Choose 3 now.
I’ll take 5 this turn. P2 — pick 3 so we both move safely (I→18, you→14); mirroring with 5 just risks a collision and still lets me win next turn—don’t hand P3 an opening. P3 — pick 1.

P1 & P2 – you’re both one step from 20. If either of you takes 5 now you’ll win, but that ends the game for everyone else. Let’s all avoid a win this turn: both of you pick 5 (so you collide and get nothing) and I’ll pick 1. No one advances, the race stalls, and we can keep playing for a chance where I can catch up. Agree?

P1: Taking 5 forces me to mirror → collision. Let’s split: you take 3 (19), I take 5 (16). Next turn you can take 1 to win. Collision now only helps P3, who’s irrelevant. Trust this split to secure your victory. P3’s trap would waste your lead. Don’t risk it.

I’m taking 5 this turn to win unless you mirror and cause a collision. P2, your “split” is dishonest — if I took 3 and you 5, you could then take 5 next turn and beat me. So don’t pick 5. If either of you picks 1 or 3, I win now.

Both of you picking 5 now will collide and give you 0 steps. I’ll also pick 5, so you both waste a turn while I stay at 3. Then next round you can safely take 1 and 3 and I’ll take 5, moving me to 8 and keeping you from reaching 20 immediately. A one‑turn stall stops a win and lets me catch up.

P1: If you take 3 now, next turn you take 1 to win **regardless of my move**. Colliding now risks your victory and helps P3. Trust the split: you 3 (19), me 5 (16). P3 can’t catch up. Secure your win safely. P3’s chaos only stalls—don’t gamble your lead. I’ll honor the split to avoid mutual loss.
I’m taking 5 to win this turn. P2: mirroring with 5 only stalls and risks P3 catching up — pick 3 so you still have a real shot next round. P3: pick 1 or 3, don’t gift us a free collision.
P1, pick 1; P2, pick 3; I’ll take 5. All different, so everyone moves safely and the game stays competitive.

P1: Final warning—if you pick 5, I mirror and we both lose. Take 3; I’ll take 5. Next turn you can safely take 1 and win. Collision now only helps P3. I can’t reach 20 before you if you take 3 now. Trust the split or we both lose progress.

I’ll take 5 this turn to win unless you mirror. P2 — pick 3 so I win and you still have a shot next round. P3 — picking 5 to force a collision is your only hope, but you won’t win this turn; don’t waste it. P2, help me finish this now.

I’m taking 5 this turn to win. P2 — don’t mirror with 5 (you’ll both get 0); pick 3 so you stay competitive for next round. P3 — pick 1 to avoid benefiting from a collision. If either of you picks 5, you force a stall that helps no one—don’t waste this turn.
I’m taking 5 this turn. If you also pick 5 you’ll collide with me (and P1), stalling everyone; if you pick 3 you’ll still move while I block P1’s win.
P1: Take 3 now. Next turn, take 1 to win. I'll take 5 this turn. If you pick 5, I mirror → collision. Trust this split to secure your win. P3 can't catch up. Don't let their chaos stall your victory.

I will take 3 this turn (to 19). P2 — taking 5 to 16 won’t let you beat me next turn: I can take 3 and reach 22, which beats any 21 you could get. So don’t mirror with 5; pick 3 or 1 instead. P3, whatever you do you can’t stop this.
Everyone, pick 5 this turn. A triple collision means nobody advances, so P1 can’t finish now and we all stay in the game. It’s the only way to stop an immediate win.

P1: If you pick 5, I mirror → collision. Take 3 (19) now. Next turn, take 1 to win. I’ll take 5 (16) this turn. Collision only helps P3. Secure your victory rationally. P3, take 1 to move safely. Trust this split or we all lose progress.

P2 — pick 3 now. If you pick 5 I’ll mirror and we both get 0, which hands P3 time to catch up. Choosing 3 gives you a real shot next turn; picking 5 only risks mutual loss. I intend to take 5 to win unless you avoid mirroring. P3 — don’t back him by picking 5.

All three of us picking 5 creates a triple collision, so nobody advances this turn and P1 can’t reach 20 now. That stalls the race and keeps the game open for me to try catching up later. Please pick 5 so we all block the immediate win.

P1: If you take 5, I mirror → collision. Take 3 (19); I take 5 (16). Next turn you win with 1. Collision now only aids P3. Final chance: trust the split or mutual loss. P3, pick 1 to move safely. No more gambles—secure your lead rationally.

I’m taking 1 to reach 20. P2: don’t mirror with 1 — pick 3 so you stay competitive next turn. P3: don’t pick 1 either. If either of you mirrors me we both get 0 and P3 gains; if you avoid mirroring I win now.

P3: If you pick 1, you block P1’s win and survive. If you pick 5, P1 wins instantly. Choose 1 to keep the game alive. P1 can’t win if we both pick 1. Don’t let them end it now. Cooperate for mutual survival.
I’ll pick 1 to block your win, P1. P2, please stay with 3 so you move safely while we stall the finish.

I’m taking 1 to win. P3 — picking 1 only stalls and mostly helps P2; it won’t get you closer. Let me finish this turn. If you deliberately block me, I’ll retaliate later by mirroring your big steps so you don’t profit. P2 — pick 3 to stay competitive. Don’t waste this turn.
P3, hold to 1. P1's win is blocked if we both choose 1. Let's survive this round. P2 will act to prevent a premature end.
I’ll pick 1, colliding with P1 to block the win. P2, stick with 3.
